title: SIPOC: Process Mapping Made Simple
headline: This free online course will teach you how to build and deploy a SIPOC process map in a variety of project settings.
description: Do you seek an effective way of determining outcomes and identifying flaws in business processes? With the help of the Six Sigma SIPOC tool, you can define and manage the activity or process of a business from start to finish before you start the process. In this course, we'll teach you about the SIPOC tool and how you can implement it in defining the inputs and outputs of a business process as well as when to use it.
courseDescription:
‘Suppliers, inputs, process, outputs and customers’ (SIPOC) is a visualisation tool used to spot all relevant aspects and inefficiencies within a process from start to finish before any work begins. This tool is excellent for analysing and polishing various projects and business processes. SIPOC can be applied to any business affair thanks to its simplified nature and application. It enables companies to streamline their workflow, pinpoint issues, solve them and eliminate ineffective activities. It is also effective for business owners as it allows them to properly know their customers, identify if customers' requests are met correctly and know whether their team is effectively providing goods and services. In this course, we will introduce you to the basic concepts of this tool and the techniques of utilising it to define and manage project and business processes.

The SIPOC approach is transparent as it clearly shows the flow of information and data within the process and hinders misunderstanding among project members and stakeholders. Do you find it difficult to trace the flow of information within your business workflow? We'll show you how information flows within a process in this approach and teach you the ‘define, measure, analyse, identify and control’ (DMAIC) management model. SIPOC is logical and seeks to know what goes into a process, how it is processed and what comes out at the end. This tool also finds out who provides and who receives within a cycle. You'll understand how the SIPOC seeks and obtains information. You'll explore the concept of process improvement, the purpose and importance of the SIPOC tool and when to utilise it, including the diagrammatic representation of this tool.

Due to the numerous factors that the success of businesses depends on, business processes must be more efficient to satisfy customers. The SIPOC tool was developed to define a poorly scoped project and business process. In light of this, you'll learn about its history and elements. Then you'll study the step-by-step process of building the tool and the procedure of utilising it for a project. Lastly, we demonstrate real-life applications. This course is for all learners, particularly business managers and those with relevant experience. Once completed, you'll be able to apply the SIPOC approach and principles in your field to make it more efficient to achieve your desired goals. So enrol and start this course today.
